verses.text: 以下是耶和華藉瑪拉基對以色列宣判的話。
verses.heading: Introduction and God’s Election of Israel

verses.text: 耶和華說：「我愛你們。」你們卻說：「你怎樣愛了我們呢？」耶和華說：「以掃不是雅各的哥哥嗎？我卻愛雅各，
惡以掃。我使以掃的山地荒涼，把他的產業給了曠野的豺狼。」

words.note: A less common meaning of 惡 (è) is 'to hate', distinct from 惡 (wù) meaning 'evil'.

verses.text: 如果以東說：「我們雖然遭破壞，但仍要把廢墟重建起來。」萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「他們只管建造，我卻要拆毀。人要稱他們為罪惡的境地，為耶和華永遠惱怒的子民。」
你們要親眼看見，也要親自說：「耶和華在以色列的境地以外，必被尊為大。」
萬軍之耶和華對你們說：「藐視我名的祭司啊！兒子尊敬父親，僕人敬畏主人。我若是父親，我該受的尊敬在哪裡呢？我若是主人，我應得的敬畏在哪裡呢？」你們卻說：「我們怎樣藐視了你的名呢？」

words.note: A biblical title for God, referring to Him as the commander of heavenly armies.

verses.heading: The Sacrilege of Priestly Service

verses.text: 「你們把污穢的食物獻在我的壇上，你們竟說：『我們怎樣污穢了你的壇呢？』因你們以為耶和華的桌子是可以藐視的。」

words.note: Lit. 'on the altar'; functions as a noun 'altar'.
Here acting as an adjective or complement.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「你們把瞎眼的獻為祭，這不是惡嗎？你們把瘸腿的和有病的獻上，這不是罪嗎？你把這樣的禮物獻給你的省長，他會喜歡你或是悅納你的禮物嗎？」

words.definition: particle forming a noun from an adjective

words.note: A verb-complement structure: 'offer to be a sacrifice'.

words.definition: particle forming a noun from an adjective
particle forming a noun from an adjective

verses.text: 現在，你們要向 神求情，好使他恩待我們。這污穢的祭物，既是你們經手獻的，他還能悅納你們嗎？萬軍之耶和華說：

words.note: Refers to the monotheistic God in Christian context.

words.definition: particle marking a passive or descriptive clause

verses.text: 「真願你們當中有人把殿門關上，免得你們在我的壇上徒然點火。」萬軍之耶和華說：「我不喜歡你們，也不從你們手中收納禮物。」

words.note: Lit. 'on the altar'; functions as a noun 'altar'.
Lit. 'in hands'; functions as a noun 'hands'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「從日出到日落的地方，我的名在列國中為大；在各處都有人向我的名燒香，獻上潔淨的禮物，因為我的名在列國中為大。」

words.note: A title for God emphasizing his power and dominion.
Common in biblical contexts; refers to Gentile nations.
Lit. 'burn fragrance'.
Often used in religious contexts for ritual purity.
Common in biblical contexts; refers to Gentile nations.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「你們卻褻瀆了我，因你們以為主的桌子是污穢的，桌上的食物也是可藐視的。

words.note: A title for God emphasizing his power and dominion.
Primarily used in religious contexts for disrespecting sacred things.
Commonly refers to God or Jesus in Christian contexts.
Often used for ritual or moral impurity in biblical texts.
Lit. 'can be despised'.

verses.text: 你們又說：『唉，真麻煩！』你們就嗤之以鼻。」耶和華說：「你們把搶來的、瘸腿的和有病的帶來作禮物，我怎能從你們的手中收受呢？」

words.note: An idiom, lit. 'to sneer at it with the nose'.
A formal term for receiving.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「凡以家畜中公的許了願，卻又詭詐地拿有殘疾的獻給主，那人當受咒詛；因為我是大君王，我的名在列國中是可敬畏的。」

words.note: A title for God emphasizing his power and dominion.
殘疾 means 'disability, infirmity'.
Commonly refers to God or Jesus in Christian contexts.
Often used in religious contexts for divine or supernatural curses.
A respectful term for a king, often used for God.
Common in biblical contexts; refers to Gentile nations.
Lit. 'can be revered and feared'.
